title: Ticket #918: JOB_ROUTER_NAME default broken in 7.3.2
description:
In 7.3.2, the default for JOB_ROUTER_NAME changed from the hostname to an empty string. This caused two problems:

  1. On restart of JobRouter, the new JobRouter did not automatically adopt jobs it was previously managing.

  2. The ManagedManager attribute in src jobs is set to an empty string, which causes JobRouter to mess up in AdoptOrphans() and think that jobs belonging to the gridmanager are src jobs of the JobRouter. This appears to not do any harm other than emitting the following confusing message: 

found orphan with no routed destination job; yielding management of it.

The change was unintentionally introduced in 49ba8395.
remarks:
2009-Nov-06 18:13:46 by danb:
I have fixed this for 7.4.1. I changed the default JOB_ROUTER_NAME to "jobrouter". This creates an incompatibility on upgrade from anything prior to 7.4.1, but it can be resolved with condor_qedit, as I will document in the release notes. I think having a fixed string rather than a hostname is better in the long run, because if the hostname changes (or the job queue is moved to a different host) jobrouter will continue owning the jobs that it created.
